intro: Matelea nigra, commonly known as black matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Matelea nigra is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
